questions.question: Hello! My name _______ John.
questions.explanation: Third person singular uses 'is' with the verb 'to be'.

questions.question: I _______ a student.
questions.explanation: First person singular uses 'am' with the verb 'to be'.

questions.question: They _______ from Spain.
questions.explanation: Plural subjects use 'are' with the verb 'to be'.

questions.question: What _______ your name?
questions.explanation: 'Your name' is third person singular, so we use 'is'.

questions.question: I _______ coffee every morning.
questions.explanation: First person singular uses base form in present simple.

questions.question: She _______ English very well.
questions.explanation: Third person singular adds -s in present simple.

questions.question: This is _______ book.
questions.explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds for singular countable nouns.

questions.question: That is _______ apple.
How _______ you?
questions.explanation: 'You' always takes 'are' in questions and statements.

questions.question: I _______ two brothers.
questions.explanation: First person uses 'have' in present simple.

questions.question: What is this?
questions.explanation: Correct structure: It is + article + noun.

questions.question: Where _______ you live?
questions.explanation: Questions with 'you' use 'do' in present simple.

questions.question: _______ do you do?
questions.explanation: 'What do you do?' asks about someone's job or occupation.

questions.question: Nice to _______ you!
questions.explanation: 'Nice to meet you' is a common greeting phrase.

questions.question: I live _______ London.
The cat is _______ the box.
questions.explanation: Use 'in' for something inside a container.

questions.question: I go _______ school every day.
questions.explanation: Use 'to' to show direction or destination.

questions.question: The picture is _______ the wall.
questions.explanation: Use 'on' for things attached to surfaces.

questions.question: I'm _______ home.
questions.explanation: Use 'at home' as a fixed expression.

questions.question: See you _______ Monday!
questions.explanation: Use 'on' with days of the week.

questions.passage: Hi! My name is Sarah. I am from the UK. I live in London with my family. I have one brother and one sister. My brother's name is Tom and my sister's name is Emma. We have a small dog. His name is Max. I love my family!
questions.question: Where is Sarah from?
questions.explanation: The text states 'I am from the UK'.

questions.passage: Hi! My name is Sarah. I am from the UK. I live in London with my family. I have one brother and one sister. My brother's name is Tom and my sister's name is Emma. We have a small dog. His name is Max. I love my family!
questions.question: How many siblings does Sarah have?
questions.explanation: Sarah has one brother (Tom) and one sister (Emma) - two siblings total.

questions.passage: Hi! My name is Sarah. I am from the UK. I live in London with my family. I have one brother and one sister. My brother's name is Tom and my sister's name is Emma. We have a small dog. His name is Max. I love my family!
questions.question: What is the name of Sarah's dog?
questions.explanation: The text states 'His name is Max'.

questions.passage: Tom is a teacher. He works at a school in Manchester. He teaches English. Tom loves his job. He starts work at 8:00 AM and finishes at 4:00 PM. After work, he goes to the gym. He likes to stay healthy.
questions.question: What does Tom do?
questions.explanation: The text clearly states 'Tom is a teacher'.

questions.passage: Tom is a teacher. He works at a school in Manchester. He teaches English. Tom loves his job. He starts work at 8:00 AM and finishes at 4:00 PM. After work, he goes to the gym. He likes to stay healthy.
questions.question: What time does Tom start work?
questions.explanation: The text says 'He starts work at 8:00 AM'.

questions.passage: Tom is a teacher. He works at a school in Manchester. He teaches English. Tom loves his job. He starts work at 8:00 AM and finishes at 4:00 PM. After work, he goes to the gym. He likes to stay healthy.
questions.question: Where does Tom go after work?
questions.explanation: The text states 'After work, he goes to the gym'.

questions.question: She _______ to the gym every morning.
I _______ my homework yesterday.
questions.explanation: Past simple tense for completed actions.

questions.question: They are _______ a movie right now.
Can you _______ me a favor?
questions.explanation: 'Do a favor' is a common phrase.

questions.question: The book is _______ the table.
I usually wake up _______ 7 o'clock.
She is _______ than her sister.
We _______ to Paris last summer.
questions.explanation: Past simple for completed past actions.

questions.question: There _______ many people at the party.
I need _______ water.
He _______ like coffee.
My birthday is _______ March.
She plays the piano very _______.
I _______ to school by bus.
The weather is _______ today.
We _______ our homework now.
She has _______ friends.
I _______ English for three years.
The cat is sleeping _______ the sofa.
Could you _______ the window, please?
I am interested _______ learning Spanish.
She _______ to the market every Saturday.
This is _______ expensive than that one.
I don't have _______ money.
He _______ his homework every day.
We are going _______ vacation next week.
The children are playing _______ the garden.
I _______ my keys yesterday.
She is _______ student in the class.
I _______ watching TV when you called.
There is _______ apple on the table.
He drives _______ carefully.
I was born _______ 1995.
She _______ a doctor.
We _______ to the cinema last night.
I like _______ music.
The shop opens _______ 9 AM.
They _______ in London.
I have _______ brother.
She is good _______ mathematics.
We _______ dinner at 7 PM.
The meeting is _______ Monday.
I _______ tired today.
She speaks English _______.
They are _______ students.
I _______ see you tomorrow.
He lives _______ New York.
The book is _______ interesting.

questions.passage: With its unique geographical location straddling Europe and Asia, Turkey has a rich and complex history that has influenced its culture, politics, and identity. For centuries, it was the center of the vast Ottoman Empire. Following the empire's collapse after World War I, modern Turkey was founded in 1923 by Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk.
questions.question: According to the passage, the establishment of modern Turkey was a direct result of _______.
options: a series of reforms to modernize the country
the nation's contemporary challenges and triumphs
the collapse of the Ottoman Empire
the adoption of the Latin alphabet
questions.explanation: The passage states that 'Following the empire's collapse after World War I, modern Turkey was founded in 1923.'

questions.passage: Climate change poses significant challenges to global agriculture. Rising temperatures and unpredictable weather patterns threaten crop yields worldwide. Scientists warn that without immediate action, food security could become a critical issue.
questions.question: The main concern expressed in the passage is _______.
questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes that climate change threatens crop yields and food security.

questions.passage: Artificial intelligence is transforming industries at an unprecedented rate. From healthcare to finance, AI systems are being deployed to enhance efficiency and accuracy. However, ethical concerns about data privacy and job displacement remain significant.
questions.question: According to the passage, AI technology _______.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions 'ethical concerns about data privacy and job displacement.'

questions.passage: Regular exercise offers numerous health benefits. It strengthens the cardiovascular system, improves mental health, and helps maintain a healthy weight. Experts recommend at least 30 minutes of moderate activity most days of the week.
questions.question: The passage suggests that regular exercise _______.
options: is only good for weight loss
should be done every single day
questions.explanation: The passage lists 'numerous health benefits' including cardiovascular, mental health, and weight maintenance.

questions.question: The company decided to _______ the project due to budget constraints.
questions.explanation: 'Postpone' means to delay, which makes sense in the context of budget constraints.

questions.question: By the time you arrive, I _______ the report.
questions.explanation: Future perfect tense is used for actions that will be completed before a specific time in the future.

questions.question: She was so tired that she could _______ keep her eyes open.
questions.explanation: 'Hardly' means 'almost not,' which fits the context of being very tired.

questions.question: The scientist's groundbreaking research _______ new possibilities in the field.
questions.explanation: 'Opened up' means to create or reveal new opportunities.

questions.question: If I _______ about the meeting earlier, I would have prepared better.
questions.explanation: Third conditional uses 'had + past participle' in the if-clause for hypothetical past situations.

questions.question: The manager asked the team to _______ their efforts to meet the deadline.
questions.explanation: 'Intensify' means to increase or strengthen, which is appropriate for meeting a deadline.

questions.question: Despite _______ hard, she couldn't pass the exam.
The exhibition will _______ until the end of the month.
questions.explanation: 'Run' in this context means to continue or operate for a period of time.

questions.question: Neither the students _______ the teacher was aware of the schedule change.
questions.explanation: 'Neither...nor' is the correct correlative conjunction pair.

questions.question: The new policy will come _______ effect next Monday.
questions.explanation: The phrase is 'come into effect', meaning to become active or valid.

questions.passage: The rise of social media has fundamentally altered how people communicate and share information. While it offers unprecedented connectivity, concerns about privacy, misinformation, and mental health impacts have emerged as significant challenges.
questions.question: According to the passage, social media _______.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions benefits (connectivity) and concerns (privacy, misinformation, mental health).

questions.question: She managed to _______ a solution to the complex problem.
questions.explanation: 'Come up with' means to think of or produce an idea or solution.

questions.question: The project requires _______ attention to detail.
questions.explanation: 'Meticulous' means showing great attention to detail, very careful and precise.

questions.question: I wish I _______ more time to spend with my family.
questions.explanation: After 'I wish' for present situations, we use past simple to express a wish.

questions.passage: Renewable energy sources such as solar and wind power are becoming increasingly cost-effective. Many countries are investing heavily in these technologies to reduce carbon emissions and combat climate change.
questions.question: The main point of the passage is that renewable energy _______.
options: is not related to climate change
questions.explanation: The passage states that renewable energy is 'becoming increasingly cost-effective.'

questions.question: The company's profits have been declining _______ the past three years.
questions.explanation: 'For' is used with a period of time (three years).

questions.passage: Sarah was feeling tired after work. She decided to _____ early and get some rest before the big presentation the next day.
questions.question: Choose the correct option to complete the sentence.
questions.explanation: 'Turn in' means to go to bed.

questions.passage: The company's profits have been _____ steadily over the past three years, mainly due to increased competition.
questions.question: Fill in the blank.
questions.explanation: The context suggests a negative trend due to competition.

questions.passage: Despite the _____ weather conditions, the rescue team managed to reach the stranded hikers.
questions.question: Select the most appropriate word.

questions.passage: The new policy aims to _____ the gap between rich and poor communities.
questions.question: Complete the sentence.
questions.explanation: 'Bridge the gap' means to reduce the difference.

questions.passage: After months of negotiations, the two countries finally _____ a peace agreement.
questions.question: Choose the best option.
questions.explanation: 'Reached an agreement' is a common collocation.

questions.passage: The scientist's theory was _____ by empirical evidence.
questions.question: Fill in the blank.

questions.passage: The children were _____ excited about the upcoming trip to the zoo.
questions.question: Select the correct word.

questions.passage: The manager decided to _____ the meeting until everyone could attend.
questions.question: Complete the text.
questions.explanation: 'Postpone' means to delay to a later time.

questions.passage: The artist's work reflects a _____ blend of traditional and modern styles.
questions.question: Choose the appropriate word.

questions.passage: The government's _____ response to the crisis was widely criticized.
questions.question: Fill in the blank.
questions.explanation: The criticism suggests the response was slow.

questions.question: Although she was tired, _____ to the party.
questions.explanation: Correct sentence structure with past tense.

questions.question: Not only did he finish the project on time, _____.
Had I known about the traffic, _____.
questions.explanation: Third conditional structure for past hypothetical.

questions.question: The more you practice, _____.
questions.explanation: 'The more...the better' is a comparative structure.

questions.question: She is looking forward _____.
questions.explanation: 'Look forward to' is followed by gerund.

questions.question: By this time tomorrow, _____.
options: we will have finished the report
questions.explanation: Future perfect for action completed by a future time.

questions.question: Seldom _____ such a beautiful sunset.
Despite _____, he managed to succeed.
questions.explanation: 'Despite' is followed by a gerund or noun.

questions.question: It's high time _____.
questions.explanation: 'It's high time' is followed by past simple.

questions.question: No sooner had she arrived _____ the meeting started.
I am going to the store. (T√ºrk√ße: Maƒüazaya gidiyorum.)
options: I am going at the store.
I am go to the store.
I will going to the store.

questions.question: Translate: 'Eƒüer erken kalksaydƒ±m, otob√ºs√º ka√ßƒ±rmazdƒ±m.'
options: If I had woken up early, I wouldn't have missed the bus.
If I woke up early, I wouldn't miss the bus.
If I wake up early, I won't miss the bus.
If I would wake up early, I wouldn't miss the bus.
If I will wake up early, I won't miss the bus.
questions.explanation: Third conditional for past unreal situation.

questions.question: √áevir: 'Bu kitap ge√ßen yƒ±l yazƒ±lmƒ±≈ütƒ±.'
options: This book had been written last year.
This book was written last year.
This book has been written last year.
This book is written last year.
This book will be written last year.
questions.explanation: Past simple passive for completed past action.

questions.question: Translate to English: 'Yaƒümur yaƒümasƒ±na raƒümen ma√ßa gittik.'
options: Despite the rain, we went to the match.
Despite it rained, we went to the match.
Although the rain, we went to the match.
Even the rain, we went to the match.
In spite it rained, we went to the match.
questions.explanation: 'Despite' is followed by a noun, not a clause.

questions.question: T√ºrk√ßeye √ßevir: 'She must have forgotten about the meeting.'
questions.explanation: 'Must have + past participle' expresses past deduction.

questions.question: √áevir: 'Ne kadar √ßok √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±rsan, o kadar ba≈üarƒ±lƒ± olursun.'
options: The harder you work, the more successful you become.
The more you work hard, the successful you become.
You work harder, you become successful.
If you work hard, you will successful.

questions.question: Translate: 'Ke≈üke daha √ßok √ßalƒ±≈ümƒ±≈ü olsaydƒ±m.'
options: I wish I had studied harder.
I wish I would study harder.
questions.explanation: 'I wish + past perfect' for past regret.

questions.question: English translation: 'O an geldiƒüinde ben √ßoktan ayrƒ±lmƒ±≈ütƒ±m.'
options: By the time he arrived, I had already left.
When he arrived, I already left.
He arrived when I had left already.
By the time he arrives, I have left.
When he will arrive, I will have left.
questions.explanation: Past perfect for action completed before another past action.

questions.question: T√ºrk√ße: 'Rarely have I encountered such rudeness.'
options: Ben nadiren b√∂yle kaba insanlarla kar≈üƒ±la≈ütƒ±m.
questions.explanation: Inverted structure for emphasis with negative adverb.

questions.question: √áevir: 'Hen√ºz karar vermedim ama muhtemelen kabul edeceƒüim.'
options: I haven't decided yet, but I will probably accept.
I didn't decide yet, but I probably accept.
I don't decide yet, but I will probably accept.
I am not deciding yet, but I probably will accept.
I won't decide yet, but I probably accept.
questions.explanation: Present perfect for unfinished action, future for prediction.

questions.question: A: Where are you going? B: _____
A: Would you mind opening the window? B: _____
A: I'm afraid I can't make it to the meeting tomorrow. B: _____
A: How do you find living in the city? B: _____
options: It's quite hectic, but I enjoy the convenience.
questions.explanation: 'How do you find' means 'What do you think about'.

questions.question: A: Could you do me a favor? B: _____
questions.explanation: Natural response to a favor request.

questions.question: A: I haven't seen you in ages! B: _____
options: I know! It's been way too long.

questions.question: A: What do you say we grab a coffee after work? B: _____
options: Sounds great! I could use a break.

questions.question: A: I'm terribly sorry for the inconvenience. B: _____
options: Don't worry about it. These things happen.

questions.question: A: Do you fancy going to the cinema tonight? B: _____
options: I'd love to, but I have other plans.

questions.question: A: How's your new job going? B: _____
options: It's challenging, but I'm learning a lot.

questions.question: Which sentence has the same meaning as 'She rarely complains about anything'?
Choose the sentence closest in meaning: 'Despite his age, he is very active.'
options: Although he is old, he is very active.
Because he is old, he is active.
He is old, so he is active.

questions.question: Similar meaning to 'No sooner had he arrived than it started raining.'
options: As soon as he arrived, it started raining.
Before he arrived, it started raining.
It will rain when he arrives.

questions.question: Same meaning: 'It's necessary for you to finish this today.'
Closest in meaning: 'I would rather stay home than go out.'
options: I prefer staying home to going out.
I must stay home instead of going out.
I will stay home and go out.
I like going out more than staying home.

questions.question: Similar meaning: 'She is unlikely to accept the offer.'
options: She probably won't accept the offer.
She will definitely accept the offer.

questions.question: Same meaning as 'He tends to arrive late.'
Closest meaning: 'Scarcely had we sat down when the phone rang.'
options: We had just sat down when the phone rang.
We sat down after the phone rang.
The phone rang before we sat down.
We didn't sit down because the phone rang.
We sit down and the phone rings.

questions.question: Similar to 'It's worth visiting that museum.'
options: That museum is worth a visit.
questions.explanation: Both structures express the same idea.

questions.question: Same meaning: 'She couldn't help laughing.'
options: She couldn't stop herself from laughing.

questions.passage: Technology has revolutionized the way we communicate. (I) Social media platforms allow people to stay connected across vast distances. (II) However, some argue that this constant connectivity has negative effects. (III) My favorite color is blue. (IV) Studies show that excessive social media use can lead to anxiety and depression. (V) Therefore, it's important to find a balance in our digital lives.
questions.question: Which sentence breaks the unity of the paragraph?
questions.explanation: Sentence III about favorite color is irrelevant to the topic.

questions.passage: Climate change is one of the most pressing issues of our time. (I) Rising global temperatures are causing ice caps to melt. (II) This leads to rising sea levels that threaten coastal communities. (III) Pizza is a popular food in many countries. (IV) Scientists warn that immediate action is needed to reduce carbon emissions. (V) Governments worldwide must work together to address this crisis.
questions.question: Which sentence is irrelevant?
questions.explanation: Sentence III about pizza is unrelated to climate change.

questions.passage: Regular exercise offers numerous health benefits. (I) It strengthens the cardiovascular system and improves heart health. (II) Exercise also helps maintain a healthy weight. (III) The stock market experienced volatility yesterday. (IV) Additionally, physical activity has been shown to reduce stress and improve mental well-being. (V) For these reasons, doctors recommend at least 30 minutes of exercise daily.
questions.question: Identify the sentence that breaks coherence.
questions.explanation: Sentence III about stock market is off-topic.

questions.passage: Learning a foreign language has many advantages. (I) It enhances cognitive abilities and improves memory. (II) Bilingual individuals often have better problem-solving skills. (III) I enjoy watching movies. (IV) Moreover, knowing another language opens up career opportunities. (V) It also allows for deeper cultural understanding and appreciation.
questions.question: Which sentence disrupts the flow?
questions.explanation: Sentence III is irrelevant to language learning benefits.

questions.passage: The ancient library of Alexandria was one of the largest and most significant libraries of the ancient world. (I) It housed countless scrolls and manuscripts. (II) Cars were invented in the late 19th century. (III) Scholars from across the Mediterranean came to study there. (IV) Tragically, the library was destroyed, and much of its collection was lost. (V) This loss represents one of the greatest tragedies in the history of knowledge.
questions.question: Which sentence should be removed?
questions.explanation: Sentence II about cars is completely unrelated.

questions.passage: Renewable energy sources are becoming increasingly important. (I) Solar and wind power are clean alternatives to fossil fuels. (II) These technologies are becoming more affordable. (III) Coffee is grown in many tropical countries. (IV) Governments are investing heavily in renewable infrastructure. (V) This shift is crucial for combating climate change.
questions.question: Select the irrelevant sentence.
questions.explanation: Sentence III about coffee doesn't relate to renewable energy.

questions.passage: Artificial intelligence is transforming various industries. (I) In healthcare, AI assists doctors in diagnosing diseases more accurately. (II) The retail sector uses AI for personalized customer recommendations. (III) Elephants are the largest land animals. (IV) Manufacturing companies employ AI to optimize production processes. (V) As AI continues to evolve, its applications will only expand further.
questions.question: Which sentence breaks the unity?
questions.explanation: Sentence III is irrelevant to AI applications.

questions.passage: Reading books regularly improves vocabulary and language skills. (I) It also enhances imagination and creativity. (II) Many successful people attribute their achievements to reading. (III) Basketball is played with five players on each team. (IV) Furthermore, reading reduces stress and promotes relaxation. (V) Therefore, developing a reading habit is highly beneficial.
questions.question: Identify the sentence that doesn't fit.
questions.explanation: Sentence III about basketball is off-topic.

questions.passage: Effective time management is essential for success. (I) Prioritizing tasks helps ensure important work gets done first. (II) Using tools like calendars and to-do lists can improve organization. (III) Dolphins are intelligent marine mammals. (IV) Breaking large projects into smaller tasks makes them more manageable. (V) With good time management, productivity and work-life balance both improve.
questions.question: Which sentence is out of place?
questions.explanation: Sentence III about dolphins is unrelated to time management.

questions.passage: The Internet has fundamentally changed how we access information. (I) _____ (II) Online encyclopedias and databases provide instant access to vast amounts of knowledge. (III) This democratization of information has empowered people worldwide. (IV) However, it has also raised concerns about information quality and fake news. (V) Critical thinking skills are more important than ever in the digital age.
questions.question: Which sentence best completes the paragraph?
options: In the past, people relied on libraries and printed materials.
Many people enjoy playing video games online.
The weather affects our daily activities.
Computers use binary code to process data.
questions.explanation: This sentence provides context about information access before the Internet.

questions.passage: _____ (I) This practice involves being present in the moment without judgment. (II) Research shows that regular meditation can reduce stress and anxiety. (III) It also improves focus and emotional well-being. (IV) Many people incorporate meditation into their daily routines. (V) Even just a few minutes per day can make a significant difference.
questions.question: Choose the best opening sentence.
options: Meditation has gained popularity as a wellness practice.
Exercise is important for physical health.
Many people work from home now.
questions.explanation: This introduces the topic of meditation that the paragraph discusses.

questions.passage: Urban gardening is becoming increasingly popular in cities. (I) People are growing vegetables and herbs on balconies and rooftops. (II) _____ (III) Community gardens also provide social benefits by bringing neighbors together. (IV) These green spaces improve air quality and reduce urban heat. (V) As cities grow, urban agriculture offers a sustainable solution.
questions.question: Select the most appropriate sentence for blank (II).
options: This practice allows city dwellers to produce their own fresh food.
Many people prefer shopping at supermarkets.
Rural areas have more space for farming.
questions.explanation: This sentence connects growing food to the benefits discussed next.

questions.passage: The concept of a circular economy is gaining traction globally. (I) Unlike the traditional linear model of take-make-dispose, it focuses on reuse and recycling. (II) Products are designed to be durable and easily repairable. (III) _____ (IV) This approach reduces waste and environmental impact. (V) Many companies are now adopting circular economy principles.
questions.question: What fits best in position (III)?
options: Materials are kept in use for as long as possible.
questions.explanation: This continues explaining circular economy principles.

questions.passage: _____ (I) Traditional storytelling methods are being supplemented by digital platforms. (II) Podcasts and audiobooks have made literature more accessible. (III) Interactive e-books engage readers in new ways. (IV) Despite these innovations, the fundamental human love for stories remains unchanged. (V) Technology simply provides new mediums for this ancient art form.
questions.question: Choose the best opening for this paragraph.
options: The art of storytelling is evolving with technology.
Many people enjoy reading physical books.
questions.explanation: This introduces the theme of storytelling and technology.

questions.passage: Remote work has transformed professional life for millions. (I) Employees can now work from anywhere with internet access. (II) This flexibility offers better work-life balance for many. (III) _____ (IV) Companies are rethinking traditional office spaces. (V) The future of work will likely be a hybrid model combining remote and in-person collaboration.
questions.question: Which sentence completes the paragraph best?
options: However, it also presents challenges like isolation and communication difficulties.
Some people prefer working in offices.
questions.explanation: This provides balance by mentioning challenges after benefits.

questions.passage: Protecting biodiversity is crucial for ecosystem health. (I) Every species plays a role in maintaining ecological balance. (II) _____ (III) Conservation efforts focus on protecting habitats and endangered species. (IV) International cooperation is essential for these efforts to succeed. (V) The survival of future generations depends on the actions we take today.
questions.question: Select the appropriate sentence for blank (II).
options: When one species disappears, it can have cascading effects throughout the ecosystem.
Many people enjoy visiting national parks.
questions.explanation: This explains why biodiversity matters, connecting to conservation efforts.

questions.passage: _____ (I) These sustainable practices reduce reliance on chemical pesticides and fertilizers. (II) Crop rotation and companion planting improve soil health naturally. (III) Many farmers are seeing increased yields and lower costs. (IV) Consumer demand for organic products continues to grow. (V) This shift represents a return to traditional farming wisdom combined with modern knowledge.
questions.question: What should begin this paragraph?
options: Organic farming methods are experiencing a renaissance.
Farming has existed for thousands of years.
questions.explanation: This introduces organic farming as the paragraph's topic.

questions.passage: Financial literacy is an essential life skill. (I) Understanding budgeting helps people manage their money effectively. (II) Knowing about investments allows for long-term wealth building. (III) _____ (IV) These skills provide security and reduce financial stress. (V) Schools should incorporate financial education into their curricula.
questions.question: Choose the best sentence for position (III).
options: Being able to distinguish between needs and wants prevents unnecessary spending.
Money has been used for centuries.
questions.explanation: This adds another important financial literacy skill fitting the pattern.

questions.passage: Cultural exchange programs benefit participants in numerous ways. (I) They promote understanding between different societies. (II) Participants develop language skills and cultural awareness. (III) _____ (IV) These experiences often inspire lifelong connections and friendships. (V) In an increasingly globalized world, such programs are more valuable than ever.
questions.question: What fits best in blank (III)?
options: Living in another country challenges assumptions and broadens perspectives.
Many universities offer study abroad programs.
questions.explanation: This explains a key benefit of cultural exchange programs.
